data.question: The doctor listened to my heartbeat with a .........
data.section: For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)
data.solution: stethoscope; a medical instrument for listening to the action of someone's heart or breathing, typically having a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the chest, and two tubes connected to earpieces.

data.question: With strong determination, Adamu was able to .... the problem
data.section: For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)
data.solution:
With strong determination, Adamu was able to surmount the problem

surmount means to overcome (a difficulty or obstacle).

data.question: It is impossible to say whether ......Ola and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.
data.section: For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)
data.solution:
It is impossible to say whether both Ola and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.

Both is used for emphasis to refer to two people or things, regarded and identified together.

data.question: He decided to wait for the bus because he had..........
data.section: For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)
data.solution:
He decided to wait for the bus because he had a lot of luggage

The noun luggage can be countable or uncountable. In more general, commonly used, contexts, the plural form will also beluggage.

data.question: The car CRUSHED him.
data.section: The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.
data.solution: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer. Option D is the correct answer here because the word ''injure contradicts crushed''.

data.question: Lamide is VERY hostile?
data.section: The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.
data.solution: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. Option A is the correct answer here.

data.question: My house is a BUNGALOW
data.section: The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.
data.solution: To answer question on emphatic stress, the sentence that doesn't have the emphatic word becomes the correct answer. From the question, the emphatic stress is the word ''BUNGALOW''. only one option does not have bungalow in it which is option A
